attributes.action: Mobile phone use whilst driving have the same penalties as drink/drugs driving.
attributes.background: Mobile phone use whilst driving appears to be killing or maiming as many people as drink/drug related accidents, therefore should carry the same penalty.

attributes.action: Investigate motor insurance policy pricing to ensure it is fair for everyone.
attributes.background: Motor insurance is a legal requirement and a social utility, but the transparency in policy pricing and post inception activities of insurers in recent years, is disadvantaging consumers and was not addressed in the Competitions and Markets Authority's investigate of 2013/14.
attributes.additional_details: The recent article from uSwitch.com, ( http://tinyurl.com/z2w83bh ), highlights that those seeking to save money by opting for third party only or third party fire and theft cover, are actually being charged more than for comprehensive cover. As motor insurance is a legal requirement, it is felt that insurance companies should be both transparent and accountable for their pricing structures, for such a economically vital, social utility as motor insurance, so that consumers are treated fairly.

attributes.action: Increase the bursary for training English teachers 2016-17
attributes.background:
The government are increasing the bursary for training English teachers from a minimum of £4,000 to £9,000 for all.
Many who are training to teach English this year will only receive £4,000 to cover living expenses. If they had applied this year they would receive over double the amount.
attributes.additional_details:
https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-and-salary/overview

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/561599/Initial_teacher_training_bursaries_funding_manual_2017_to_2018.pdf

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools with social media accounts to be set to private.
attributes.background: The primary school my children attend has a public Twitter profile that they post photos of the children on. 3 explicit Twitter profiles have retweeted and liked a photo of my child. It was brought to my attention that the school profile is public and it is not compulsory to have it set to private.
attributes.additional_details: A public twitter account allows anyone to access details of what school a child goes to, their name and also what they look like. The pictures can be saved by any person who wishes. The terrifying thing is that an individual doesn't even have to have a Twitter account themselves to access a public account. The school my children attend are refusing to make the account private as there is nothing to say they have to. I want it to be made compulsory for all schools with social media accounts to have them set to private.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a parent to allow child access to age inappropriate material
attributes.background: This needs to happen sooner rather than later because the technology is becoming more of the norm for young impressionable children and games that glorifying gang affiliations, drug dealing , mass shootings act now for our next generation of leaders

attributes.action: Stop weighing young children at school and labelling them in weight catergories
attributes.background:
Children as young as 4 are being weighed at school and parents told their child is underweight, healthy, overweight and even very overweight!! 
What kind of damage is this doing! 
Stop putting so much pressure on children to fit into a category that isn't even realistic.
attributes.additional_details:
My son was recently regarded as overweight when his friend is acceptable. My son is 6 cm taller and only 7lb heavier! My friend worries her child is underweight but is deemed acceptable. Skin and bones is not a healthy target! 
I've personally suffered from an eating disorder and being told my child is overweight at 5 upset me. He's 114.6 cm and 23 kg!!
It's ridiculous and needs to be stopped!

attributes.action: Supermarket type trolleys to have a coin lock, or some other security system.
attributes.background: There need to be a law mandating trolley owners, supermarkets etc, to fit security features such as coin locks or similar, in order to keep abandoned trolleys out of our river systems and countryside.
attributes.additional_details: Much has been done to improve the water quality in our rivers and streams. Dumping into our waterways is commonplace and a disgrace. There is difficulty in  resolving these issues, but supermarket trolleys are one area that might be tackled.  A recent flood left a pile of 50+trolleys and tyres in a weirpool. Children were  climbing up and throwing trolleys into deep water of the weirpool.  2 kayakers were pushed by the current  into a submerged trolley, one being inverted. He nearly drowned.

attributes.action: MPs taking other jobs of more than 20 hours a week must stand for re-election.
attributes.background: George Osborne is only the latest, but nevertheless the most egregious example of an MP expressing contempt for both parliament and his constituents by hoovering up money wherever it can be found.

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory refresher course and driving test for people over 70
attributes.background:
Far too often we hear of older drivers who have lost control of their car and caused serious damage to themselves and others, sometimes killing people. 

Many know their elderly relatives are no longer fit for driving but are unable to stop them from getting behind a wheel.
attributes.additional_details:
To make our roads safer and help avoid these tragedies we should introduce a mandatory test to make sure drivers are still fit to be on the road. 

These courses, tests and lessons will provide additional income and help protect the public from accidents that could have been avoided.

attributes.action: Give pensioners with Annuities or annuity based products access to their cash.
attributes.background: This does not mean  creating a second hand market but where two parties agree ie the Provider and customer remove the unauthorised payment charge of 55% by a simple change in legislation .

attributes.action: Scottish vote for independence! The Scottish government pays!
attributes.background: The Scottish government has had it's chance. The rest of the of the UK should not have to pay because the First Minister did not like the result of the first vote.

attributes.action: Make the BBC a Pay per view Channel and abolish the TV licence.
attributes.background: Why should we be obliged to pay a TV licence for the BBC when they abuse the money of it. If it is to watch all channels than the BBC should give a part to all of them! Make the BBC a pay per view channel and let people decide either or not they want to watch this channel and abolish the TV licence

attributes.action: Devote some of the UK's aid budget to supporting Ugandan LGBT refugees in Kenya.
attributes.background: Homophobic laws in Uganda cause many LGBT people to seek refuge in Kenya where they apply for refugee status. Even in Kenya they are persecuted and subject to police brutality and often become destitute while their asylum claims are processed. They despirately need safe accommodation and food.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Nigeria

http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/meet-lgbti-ugandan-community-living-fear-kenyas-kakuma-refugee-camp-1566516

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/the-groundtruth-project/inside-the-nightmares-of_b_7674502.html

attributes.action: Stop the formal testing of children at primary school in the UK.
attributes.background: Stop the UK Government from forcing primary schools to subject our young children to regular formal testing. It is no longer just SAT's in year 2 and 6. Children are now forced three times per academic year to go through week long tests carried out like formal exams with exam papers and time limits.
attributes.additional_details: There is no evidence that subjecting young children to these formal test situations improves academic achievement. There is however a lots of evidence that mental health issues, depression, stress and anxiety are increasing in our children and young people. There is also much evidence around the importance of play and physical exercise especially for primary age children. So why is the UK Government forcing schools to subject our children to these formal exam situations? Help protect childhood.

attributes.action: Stop speed restricted vehicles from overtaking during peak hours on motorways
attributes.background:
HGVs frequently 'elephant race' trying to pass each other. This overtaking frequently takes up to 10 miles due to the subtle differences in speed limiter calibration. 

This causes long tailbacks, dangerous pulsating traffic flow and frustration to other motorists leading to dangerous manoeuvres.
attributes.additional_details:
No other form of transport, motorised, cycling or pedestrian would you consider an overtake that took this time
Transitioning from a 2 lane motorway to a 3 lane section can lead to HGVs 3 abreast creating a rolling road block for several miles
HGVs have blind spots, pulling into spaces that either don’t exist or into traffic flow travelling much faster
Cranes, vintage vehicles and buses only capable of travelling at agricultural speeds to have time restrictions motorway travel times

attributes.action: Give Self Employed Trainers  rights & access to  industrial tribunal services
attributes.background: Pass a bill to regulate awarding bodies of security level 2 qualifications disciplinary procedures when dealing with trainers. Stipulate Awarding bodies provide clear guidelines such as a documented strike 1,2,3 warnings, provide hearings & provide trainers/teachers an industrial  tribunal service.
attributes.additional_details: As a trainer of a security qualification an individual has to be  approved by a pick of 5 awarding bodies. Training is mandatory to work in the industry hence awarding bodies can pick and choose trainers. Awarding bodies  can place maladministration labels on an individuals resulting in a  life time ban without hearing. Most trainers earn the same as employed and can not afford the risk to go to an industrial tribunal leaving them exposed to anti-competitive practices, discrimination etc.

attributes.action: Clerks of the House of Commons to continue wearing wigs and court dress
attributes.background: We believe that changes to the attire of the clerks after the February recess fail to take account of the traditions of the House of Commons.  The so called 'executive order' needs to be debated be repealed.  It ain't broke, so don't fix it

attributes.action: Give clear statement about the post-brexit future of EU citizens
attributes.background: I'd like Theresa May to finally give a clear statement about the post-brexit future of EU citizens who've been living and working in the UK for many years. Their future is now one big question mark and people need to know what's going to happen to them. For many UK became home and only place to live
attributes.additional_details: Since the start of brexit campaign the subject of EU citizens living and working in UK has beed avoided and so far there are only questions and no answers at all. People made UK their homes, have jobs, children (who often are british citizens), bought their first houses and settled in. Now this all is one big question mark and people fear that their lives can be turned upside down within two years time.

attributes.action: Balance the petition system by allowing people to sign both for and against.
attributes.background:
I'm calling for the petition system to take both for and against votes while retaining the 100,000 signatures needed. 
This way overall public opinion will drive the need for a response or parliamentary debate. 
The current system does not give a voice to those people who agree with something.

attributes.action: Fine people who smoke on hospital grounds or have security to escort them out!
attributes.background: I not only work in the nhs and see this on a daily basis .But I now have a 12 day old baby born at 25 weeks fighting for her life. And where people smoke in the hospital grounds the ward she is on is right above where everyone smokes and it travels right to her window! I've argued many times with
attributes.additional_details: The inconsiderate people smoking out the entrance of the ward. But they do not care and do not move as they know there is no one there to stop them! You can smell the smoke all through the corridor of the hospitals entrances . And other staff members don't even think to question the people doing it.They even sit in the wheel chairs outside smoking .Do the wheelchairs even get cleaned for when the porter needs it for the next patient? The signs are not enough !! This is at st Georges hospital.

attributes.action: Introduce Regular Digital Voting Referendums On The Issues That Matter
attributes.background: The technology for 'push-button digital voting' by mobile phone or pc already exists. People vote on tv show contestants all the time. Mobile and online banking are deemed to be secure. Thus there's no reason why this technology cannot be adapted for digital referendums to truly empower the people.
attributes.additional_details:
Prime Minister Theresa May has spoken of the 'shared society.' It would be nice to see some power being shared with our representatives at the UK Parliament and the devolved Parliaments and Assemblies. 

Regular digital voting on issues that matter at a local and national level, would leave everyone clear on what the majority wish for on any number of issues. A more intelligent vote could also arise; Eg: someone with good knowledge of farming would vote on it, though perhaps not vote on fishing.

attributes.action: Give the British public a referendum on cutting foreign aid. Give it to the NHS
attributes.background:
An overwhelming 78 per cent of voters want cuts to Britain’s wasteful £12.4 billion annual aid budget, and the money diverted to the Health Service instead. 
If a tenth of the aid budget was diverted to the NHS, the £1.24 billion would pay for around three million stays in a hospital bed.

attributes.action: Cease backing UN resolution outlawing Israel’s presence beyond 1967 borders
attributes.background: Britain's vote to outlaw Israel's presence beyond the 1967 borders is unacceptable and it is supporting a one-sided motion. We must stop putting pressure on Israel, and allow the Israelis and Palestinians to negotiate their positions. This is key to prevent negative effects of religion on Britain.

attributes.action: The National Curriculum to be run and controlled by an Education Council
attributes.background: Education has been used to sway voters for too long now. With each new Government comes a new National Curriculum. New 'ideas' or 'beliefs'. It's time for stability and for education to be in control of professionals and not politicians, by forming an Education Council of former Heads and teachers.
attributes.additional_details: Since 2010, the Education Department has been run by an accountant, a journalist, a solicitor and an economist. What qualifications do they have to decide on the best course of action for our children? The Government are too results driven. Schools should be places where children feel safe, where children go to enjoy learning, where children discover a passion for a given subject area. This is not happening under the current scrutiny from those who don't understand the education system.

attributes.action: Drivers of motor vehicles to use headlights at all times of the day and night.
attributes.background: Vehicles are often driven in poor light conditions. Vehicle colourings can make them nearly invisible against background colours. In daylight they can also be difficult to see. Compulsory headlights would make vehicles more visible and improve road safety. A no cost issue to motorists. A WIN WIN.

attributes.action: Cyclists should have legally registered identification plates on their cycles.
attributes.background: This is to enable identification of, and consequences for, cyclists who break road traffic laws and cause minor or major road incidents.
attributes.additional_details: There have been previous attempts to pass such laws but they have been generally tied in with the introduction of proposed insurance and road tax for cyclists.  Most cyclists, however, also own cars and so the concept of paying for road tax and insurance twice is an incredibly controversial one.  In order to keep this proposal straightforward, I am suggesting simply that cycle registration becomes compulsory in the same way car registration is, as a means of identification.

attributes.action: Solve the gridlock occuring on the M5 between Almondsbury & Clevedon.
attributes.background: Due to the design of the Avonmouth Bridge, the 3 mile long queues to leave the M5 at junction 19 (Portishead) both morning and evening, repeated accidents between junctions 18 and 19, in part due to road design, inpart due to careless driving, life on the M5 is now intolerable.
attributes.additional_details: One needs only reference Inrix, view CCTV or stand on a bridge to see the chaos and misery caused to locals, commuter, holiday makers and businesses. Now is the time to design a 2nd Avonmouth crossing, take local traffic for Portishead off at junction 18 (or use a design similar to J5-6, M20), bulldoze Gordano services, redesign junction 19, put in SMART motorway, widen the carriageways and if necessary re-route the motorway for long distance traffic from junction 15 to a new junction 19A.

attributes.action: Open places for homeless and people alone to socialise
attributes.background: With Christmas day coming up many people will be spending it alone and walking into new year alone, this petition is to try and get the government to agree to try and fund places for people like this. As people of the community to volunteer to help give the homeless and others to not feel alone.
attributes.additional_details: This may not be an issue for the government to agree on but it could be possible for them to consider funding socialise centres! Yes we have many places for these people like "feed the homeless" but what about the people sat alone on Christmas Day with nobody, reminding themselves they are alone! By signing this it will show the government their funding would be useful and many people in the community would love the opportunity to volunteer. Thankyou for reading please sign! See what we can do.

attributes.action: Make the police non emergency number 101 a freephone number.
attributes.background: Currently the cost of calling 101 is 15p per call, yet the similar non emergency number of the NHS 111 is free, this needs to be resolved as most people in the UK use mobile phones and mostly on contracts where their minutes wouldn't cover the 15p charge to report a crime.

attributes.action: Back date money owed by HMRC to families with disabled children
attributes.background: HMRC has announced that it will only pay back money owed to families with disabled children for 2016/17. This is wrong. Families living day to day with the challenges of supporting a disabled child are themselves vulnerable. HMRC must repay all DLA tax credits owed to these families without delay.

attributes.action: To build a new Northern bypass around Ipswich
attributes.background: The Orwell Bridge has been closed in Ipswich all morning due to high winds, causing traffic chaos and gridlock in the town, it's about time a Northern bypass around Ipswich was built to defer the traffic from the town when the bridge is closed.
attributes.additional_details: It's 2016 and it's ridiculous that such a large town is so reliant on the bridge being open, as soon as there's an accident or bad weather, it's closed and the traffic has nowhere to go but through the town, which the infrastructure just cannot cope, costing businesses millions of pounds in lost revenue, especially haulage companies as they're reliant on the a14 to and from the port of felixstowe, get this Northern bypass built.

attributes.action: A 2nd EU Referendum to be held with Compulsory Voting for the Eligible.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to Conduct a 2nd Referendum with Compulsory voting  for all who are eligible, with an abstention option on the ballot paper. This will give a true majority of the UK voters wishes regarding the EU and a true mandate to Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The British Election Study asked a question on whether people regretted how they voted or not. Only 1% of people who voted Remain said they regretted their vote, but 6% of people who voted Leave said they regretted their vote.

attributes.action: Legislate against premature marketing of festivals, especially Christmas
attributes.background: The excitement of Christmas is spoiled by premature marketing in shops, 'papers and TV. We are not killjoys, but tinselled TV ads and festive trees in Malls in early November dwindles our joy well before the event. We propose, under penalty, the first day of marketing for Christmas as 1st of Dec.
attributes.additional_details: Other festivals can be included in legislation (e.g. 1 week prior to Valentines, Easter, Halloween) but the law must first target Christmas. We accept there are commercial ventures that that may be exempt since they rely on festivals such as Christmas for much of their business and therefore need to market early, e.g. Christmas hamper savings, turkey butchers, greeting card shops, booking for a Christmas party, etc. Punishments for breaking the law should raise money for children's charities.

attributes.action: Allow existing annuities to be transferred into another existing private pension
attributes.background: Government has cancelled previous intention to allow annuities to be sold.

attributes.action: Invest more money into front line policing increase number of response officers
attributes.background:
More and more officers are being assaulted each year. With the lack of numbers it will soon become a huge safety issue. 

On top of that, too often we hear the story that response officers to not have the time, resources or funding to deal with/investigate an offence.
attributes.additional_details: 2015 saw a police officer assaulted every 22 minutes in England & Wales. This is a growing number and we need to invest to protect not only the public from these damaging cuts but the officers themselves.

attributes.action: Reinstate Postgraduate Loans To Other UK Citizens Living & Studying in England.
attributes.background: Appeal Against Student Finance England's decision to withdraw the funding of Scottish, Northern Irish and Welsh Postgraduate Students living and studying in England.
attributes.additional_details: The SFE waited until all the Scottish, Northern Irish and Welsh students living and studying in England had registered with their University before blocking their payments without any warning or notification. The SFE should be held accountable of how they have treated so many UK non-English nationals resulting in them with no funding and being forced off their studies. Is Student Finance England discriminating against UK citizens who are non-English Nationals from access to Higher Education?

attributes.action: Ban advertising of alcohol, restrict opening times, picture of damaged liver
attributes.background:
In September of this year my partner Claire died due to long term alcohol dependancy, more or less my last words to Claire was that I was going to try and help others in the same situation. 

Being alcohol dependant doesn't just effect the person it also effects close family and friends
attributes.additional_details:
What people don't realise is what damage drinking too much  alcohol can do, in many cases people with liver disease don't have any noticeable symptoms until their live is badly damaged. 
Those systems are.
Jaundice,Oadema, swelling in abdomen, itchy skin, weakness and muscle wasting,insomnia nose bleeds and bleeding gums.
To give you some figures on alcohol abuse it cost the NHS  £2000 per day for a level 3 patient on intensive care It is commonly said that it costs overall to the society £21 bn

attributes.action: Parliament must vote on initial aims of Brexit and then trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: The country voted 52:48 to leave the EU in June and to make Parliament sovereign in the UK. To be sovereign, Parliament must therefore be able to vote on and scrutinise the initial aims for Brexit negotiations and then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered, not leaving it to royal prerogative.
attributes.additional_details: In determining the starting point of Brexit, our elected representatives must have the chance to properly scrutinise and vote on the aims of the negotiations. MPs must engage with their constituents and all stakeholders to represent us, the people, in determining what the aims of Brexit should be. Our elected MPs should then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered so negotiations start following these aims set out by Parliament. To be truly sovereign, Parliament must play its full role in Brexit.

attributes.action: Allow full legal costs to be taken into account by the Child Support Agency
attributes.background: When one partner decides to breakup a relationship and leave, taking the children and denying the other partner an acceptable level of access and/or communication, the only recourse the other partner has to achieve reasonable access to their children is to take very costly legal action.
attributes.additional_details: Also, if despite paying a reasonable level of maintenance based on previous household bills, the leaving partner uses the CSA to obtain the maximum possible then paying the resultant determination can drain any available funds to pay for legal costs. This creates a very uneven playing field and therefore, full legal costs should be taken into consideration by the CSA in order that a parent can legally fight for their rights.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for food outlets to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background:
In the uk it is not a legal requirement for food outlets to display their food hygiene ratings. 
 

Many people don't know that you can check online, many people assume the government wouldn't allow somewhere to be open if they received 0-1-2 stars. 

But they are aloud to stay open.
attributes.additional_details:
Check out local places in your area. 
http://ratings.food.gov.uk

My local chicken shop received a 0..
Local Costcutter received a 1
Local Cafe received a 1
All are still open.

Major improvements required
System or checks in place to ensure that food sold or served is safe to eat, the food safety officer has confidence that standards will be maintained in future.

Cleanliness and condition of facilities and building to enable good food hygiene.

http://www.youtube.com/user/FoodStandardsAgency

attributes.action: Mandatory weekly hour classes in current politics in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Give secondary school children a chance to learn about the different parties in the UK and their policies (etc) from an unbiased perspective. Learn about current affairs both locally and abroad, voting etc. Give everyone the right to unbiased knowledge to make well informed decisions as adults.
attributes.additional_details: I propose hour classes once a week in order to keep children engaged and updated. Teach the requirements for voting, the process of voting, current party policies for each party, practice voting etc. Engage in current debates and learn of foreign affairs that affect both the UK and the world. Allow them the advantage of awareness when coming to the voting age for both fair and thoroughly considered decisions. Studying Holocaust Literature in my degree has inspired me to propose this.

attributes.action: Let NHS off £1,000 overseas immigration skills charge
attributes.background:
The charge aims to reduce Britain’s reliance on migrant workers and train British staff to fill those jobs.

For the NHS, this will mean paying millions for the thousands of non-EU doctor and nurses already working here. This is money the NHS could use to provide better health and care services.
attributes.additional_details:
Immigration Skills Charge
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/governments-new-immigration-skills-charge-to-incentivise-training-of-british-workers

BBC: Let NHS off £1,000 overseas doctors charge, urge unions
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-39249726

British Medical Association
https://www.bma.org.uk/collective-voice/influence/key-negotiations/training-and-workforce/immigration-skills-charge

attributes.action: There should be a legislation for all hospitals to have post-pay parking system.
attributes.background: When in A&E, so many times you either pay a lot more than the time you actually use the car park. If you pay less, you either have to keep going back to extend parking or you will get a Parking charge notice. It is so unfair for hospitals to charge money for time when parking is not used
attributes.additional_details: When going to A&E you don't know how long you will be waiting before being seen by a consultant. So many times you either pay a lot more than the time you actually use the car park. If you pay less, you either have to keep going back to extend parking or you will get a Parking charge notice. It is so unfair for hospitals to charge money from you for the time you are not even using the parking. A system with ANPR where you only pay for the time you have used the parking will be fairer.

attributes.action: Make St. David's day (March 1st) a public holiday in Wales
attributes.background: I believe that St. David's day should be a public holiday for the Welsh. This was declined by Tony Blair in the past even though a majority (87%!) Wanted the change.

attributes.action: Protect Freeholders from fraud by estate management companies.
attributes.background: Freeholders currently don't enjoy the same protection as leaseholders from unjustified estate charges. They are currently open to widespread and systematic fraud and some so called “estate management companies” are taking full advantage of this.
attributes.additional_details:
In all cases, regardless of whether it is freeholders or leaseholders who are being charged these fees…

It must be made a requirement that all fees pass the test of “reasonableness” and are backed by proper documentation.

Arbitrary unspecified “management fees” should be banned as I believe they already are in Scotland.

attributes.action: Make Bullying in the workplace a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Bullying is wrong. Bullying goes on in the workplace.  It can be being left out , whatever it may be.  It can be being ignored.  It can be not getting that promotion.  Social media passive aggressive post. Commenting on work performance negatively, and talking in derogatory terms.
attributes.additional_details: Workplace Bullying is rife. A real problem, that can have severe consequences to a person being bullied. Just because a manager may smile at you, does not mean that they aren't bullying someone else.

attributes.action: I want you to to make it law that all Cats & Kittens to be microchipped.
attributes.background: With so many Cats being killed in road traffic accidents, then being discarded by most councils as waste. Many people want to know what has happened to their pet, whether killed in a road accident or lost.

attributes.action: Make it maditory for people over 60 to take a driving test every 5 years
attributes.background: Although evidence does suggest that most accidents are caused by 17-24 year old drivers, it is well known that the human body isnt as quick to respond as it was when you are younger. I propose it is about time we had a manditory test for those over the age of 60 every 5 years to reduce deaths.
attributes.additional_details: In 2011, there were 10,974 accidents involving elderly drivers over the age of 70.

attributes.action: Review VED switch to mileage based tax system
attributes.background: For years we have been paying road tax on a fixed rate system. This is old out dated. Punishing those who barely use the roads while those who abuse them barley cover the damage they cause.
attributes.additional_details: Allowing those who do extreme amounts of mileage to pay the same rate as those who barely use the road is unfair. I personally fall into both catagories. I do approx 50k a year for work and less than 2k in my own personal vehicle. Yet i pay more tax for my personal vehicle than my company does for the vehicle doing x25 the mileage. monitor fuel usage when you register a car. You get a fuel card u swipe everytime you fill up (similar to a company fuel card) to prevent tampering. No card no fuel.

attributes.action: Stop married personnel paying for own home and camp accommodation
attributes.background: Currently the army charges married personnel for camp accommodation if they own a permenant family home until they over the age of 37
attributes.additional_details: I'm currently serving in the British Army attached to the Navy, as I bought my own home I have to commute every weekend. Within the navy married personnel who own and live in a house do not require to pay for camp accommodation. But Army policy you have to pay for accommodation until you are 37 which I believe is unfair.  As the reason why serving members need the accommodation is to allow them a place to sleep and administrate whilst away from their personal home.
